subject: Re: [junit] Re: Mock and collections.
msgSnippet: ... Yes, I suppose so. Since I don t know how to avoid it, I look to minimize the number of times I need to do it. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger ::
messageBody:
sky eagle wrote:

> >I would try extracting the foreach loop into its own little method, then
> >test that method separately from the larger MethodToBeTested. This way,
> >you can write the tedious child-creating code for fewer tests.
>
> While when you test the larger Method under test, still, you need to create
> the children, right?

Yes, I suppose so. Since I don't know how to avoid it, I look to
minimize the number of times I need to do it.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
